Articles.Content:
So I was setting up a commsat network. I wanted to put three in orbit around the sun... 

So I launched three identical rockets into three different orbits to get them into position, 

> ![screenshot57.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1473137/screenshot57.png)
> ![screenshot58.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1473137/screenshot58.png)

and went to a parked ship at KSC to time warp all three into position... 

> ![screenshot56.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1473137/screenshot56.png)

Well, I went to the first ship and it was in pieces. 

> ![screenshot55.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1473137/screenshot55.png)

This happened two more times...

> ![screenshot59.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1473137/screenshot59.png)
> ![screenshot62.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1473137/screenshot62.png)

This happen to anyone else? It seems common in really high orbits (past minimus) or Kolar orbits..

This is a bug in 0.15.1 and has been fixed in 0.15.2. Patch to latest update.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
